column2: ENGLISH
If chance will have me king, why, chance may crown me without my stir?
Look like the innocent flower, but be the serpent under it!
Is this a dagger which I see before me, the handle toward my hand?
We are men, my liege.. Ay, in the catalogue ye go for men!
My voice is in my sword! Thou bloodier villain than terms can give thee out!
Something is rotten in the state of Denmark!
Once more unto the breach, dear friends, once more! Or close the wall up with our English dead!
How sweet a thing it is to wear a crown within whose circuit is Elysium, and all that poets feign of bliss and joy!
Time shall unfold what plighted cunning hides: Who cover faults, at last shame them derides!
Now, gods, stand up for bastards!
We saw the best of our time: machinations, hollowness, treachery, and all ruinous disorders, follow us disquietly to our graves..
How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is, to have a thankless child!
He is come to ope the purple testament of bleeding war!
My large kingdom, for a little grave. A little, little grave, an obscure grave!
Now is the winter of our discontent made glorious summer by this son of York!
So wise, so young, they say, do never live long..
True hope is swift, and flies with swallows wings: Kings it makes gods, and meaner creatures kings!
A horse! A horse! My kingdom for a horse!
If you deny me, fie upon your law! There is no power in the decrees of Venice!
All his successors, gone before him, have done’t. And all his ancestors, that come after him, may..
Cowards die many times before their deaths, the valiant never taste of death but once..
Treason has done his worst: nor steel, nor poison, malice domestic, foreign levy, nothing can touch him further..
He full of bashfulness and truth, loved much, hoped little, and desired nought..
For he that does good, having the unlimited power to do evil, deserves praise not only for the good which he performs, but for the evil which he forbears
Saint George and the Dragon! Bonny Saint George for Merry England! The castle is won!
I know of no one in the realm who would not more fitly to come to me than I to him..
By God's blood, thy father slew mine, and so will I do thee and all thy kin!
Seven feet of English ground, or as much more as he may be taller than other men!
A man should suffer greatly for his lord, endure both biting cold and sweltering heat, and sacrifice for him both flesh and blood
That fatal day for England, the sad destruction of our dear country!
He has learned much who knows the pain of struggle..
The gates of monarchs are arch'd so high that giants may jet through and keep their impious turbans on!
There's such divinity doth hedge a king, that treason can but peep to what it would..
Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown..
Every subject's duty is the king's, but every subject's soul is his own!
Fearless minds climb soonest unto crowns!
The king-becoming graces, I have no relish of them!
Ay, every inch a king!
Until a king be by, and then his state empties itself, as doth an inland brook into the main waters..
Yet looks he like a king: behold, his eye, as bright as is the eagle's, lightens forth controlling majesty!
Let us sit upon the ground, and tell sad stories of the death of kings..
The king's name is a tower of strength, which they upon the adverse party want..
And kind as kings upon their coronation day!
As yourselves your empires fall, and every kingdom hath a grave!
It is something to hold the scepter with a firm hand!
A merry monarch, scandalous and poor..
Here lies our mutton-looking king, whose word no man relied on, who never said a foolish thing, nor ever did a wise one..
Treason only matters when it is committed by trusted men..
No bravery is such a virtue as the Graele may gain!
The foremost art of kings is the ability to endure hatred..
Kings have many ears and eyes..
That I may truly say with the hook-nosed fellow of Rome, I came, I saw, and overcame!
